bibl.title: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, August 7, 1937

div1.p: Moran requests the address of a University of Virginia medical school classmate of his who was working at the Mayo Clinic in 1931.

div1.head: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, August 7, 1937
div1.opener:
COMPAÑIA SUNOCO DE CUBA, S.A.
AGENTES EXCLUSIVOS DE
SUN OIL COMPANY
SUN OILS
AVENIDA MENOCAL NO. 102-A
HABANA,
Aug. 7, 1937.
CABLE Y}
TELEGRAFO}
“SUNOCO”
CLAVE BENTLEY
TELEFONO U-6148
SUNOCO
DESTILADO AL MERCURIO
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
MAYO CLINIC,
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Last evening, while glancing thru the 1931 edition
of the Alumni Directory of the University of Virginia, I ran
across the name of Doctor Crenshaw who was a classmate of mine
in the Medical Department at UVA in the term year 1901-02.
According to the Directory, he was Urologist at the Mayo Clinic
in that year or when the Directory was being prepared. If
memory serves me right he was a brilliant student. I, unfortun-
ately, was handicapped and too much concerned about my slim
educational nest egg to do justice to my studies. This was
fully set forth in the “story” I prepared for you and forwarded
with my letter of July 24th.

If Dr. Crenshaw is still at Mayo Clinic, will you
please remember me kindly to him. He probably has forgotten
all about me. If he has not, however, will you be kind enough
to send me his address or rather, let me know if he is still
connected with the Clinic. I should like to get in touch with
him.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, John J. Moran. Address:
c/o Cia. Sunoco de Cuba, S. A.,
Avenida Menocal No. 102-A,
Havana, Cuba.
